website_summaries.verdict: The premier name in swimwear adds its expertise to swimming gloves, providing excellent propulsion as well as resistance training capabilities.
pros: Rubber palm grip and flexible webbing are great for both swimming and water workouts
Gloves are durable, even with repeated use
Velcro closure is strong and stays put
Really give the muscles a workout during exercise, yet are great for anyone with arthritis
cons: Can be tricky to determine the correct size
will need to determine wrist and palm areas for adequate fit

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for your Aquatic Workouts!
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect to enjoy using these Swim Gloves as much as I do. I'm a 71-year-old "Lap" Swimmer & find swimming to be an excellent overall workout for me. I decided to try these to improve my upper body strength & water resistance conditioning. They are terrific & give me all the resistance needed. They're very comfortable to wear, well made & I've already noticed a difference in conditioning since I started using them. I previously tried the "Agility Hand Paddles" & hated them, as they were uncomfortable to use & did not allow me the smooth stroke I was looking for. These Speedo Aqua Fit Training gloves are perfect for me!!!
customer_reviews.author: ArlenOnLine

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last, faded, tore.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product until the cloth began to a split and expose the index finger. Also splitting at the seams between fingers. Faded fairly quickly too. They were used 3-5 times per week and rinsed after every swim in cool water.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane Knott

customer_reviews.title: work well, but be careful of shoulder injuries
customer_reviews.text: These are great for " resistance" ; slowly building muscle tissue .......... do be careful though as they can cause undue shoulder stress / possible shoulder injury what I do is use them for 1/2 of my workout , then remove so I can get more speed / better cardio also they take a long time to dry .....but nonetheless ... make sure you rinse them after each use
customer_reviews.author: Karen & Alfons

customer_reviews.title: Holds Up Well
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for swimming during the Covid lockdown when swimmers were told to bring their own equipment. I wanted these to provide resistance for my arms and they deliver nicely. I have been using these for six days a week since mid-June. The hook-and-loop closure at the wrists is still holding up well. I have small wrists and the very end of the strap does not touch the pad on the wrist part, and that is the only part of the closure strap that flips up when I am swimming. I am glad I chose these swim gloves. They dry quickly after swimming so they are ready for the swim the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Work for me ... great for water aerobics
customer_reviews.text: These work for me for water aerobics and are a great substitute for water weights ... still get the workout without stressing my fingers. I bought a medium and should have bought a small ... the comments about not worrying about the size due to the velcro adjustment was correct. They stay on comfortably even though they are a little big for my hand. I'd buy them again, but I'd get a small.
customer_reviews.author: On-line Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I think I received a knock-off
customer_reviews.text: This is at least the fourth pair I have purchased through Amazon. This one is falling apart after about three weeks of use. The Velcro closure is coming lose and the logo on the tab has faded. I think it's a knock-off. Of course, the return window has closed and I can't figure out how to contact Amazon to explain the problem.
customer_reviews.author: inge

customer_reviews.title: Sizing has changed!
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered these gloves in the past in a size LARGE and they fit me just right. This time I ordered 2 pairs in size large and they are too big. The sizing has changed and I would like to send them back. But I see that in order to do this, I have to pay to ship them back. I do not think I should have to pay to return them when the fault is not mine that the sizing has changed. The last time I ordered the gloves was on June 20th, 2015. You can check back in my orders. At that time the sizing was such that the large fit me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Graydon

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. Much more flexible than other water gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. Much more flexible than other water gloves. The velcro wrist closure is so much better than other gloves with zippers. There is no awkwardness when putting these on. Appear to be very well constructed. My husband wears them to swim laps and in a water aerobics class to add resistance. A definite good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy N.

customer_reviews.title: Great, but smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: These were what my mom wanted, but the medium was too small. She had been wearing the medium gloves at the gym pool, but didn't take into account they might be a different brand, or were probably older and stretched out. Luckily she was able to pass them along to someone with slightly smaller hands who could use them, and ordered the large. She's not a big woman, so if you think you have small hands, you might order up.
customer_reviews.author: R F

customer_reviews.title: Great aqua gloves
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace ones I bought about 10yrs ago. Holds up wonderfully. I ordered same size large. The do run a little big but still work great. I get good resistance when working out doing water aerobics. Definitely recommend. Love the fact has grip on inside palm and neoprene on the rest of glove with adjustable Velcro closure.
customer_reviews.author: dnvolley

customer_reviews.title: Aqua Zumba PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE AMAZING! I do Aqua Zumba about once a week, and since I bought these the workout has been MUCH more difficult, I can actually feel my muscles having to work now! I would say err to caution on the sizing, for me, the fingers are looser than I would like, but the palm area is borderline tight. If you are inbetween sizes, you might consider going a size up so that your hand doesn't feel squished. My friend ordered these too, but got a size down (where I got the size up) and we both prefer mine. Just some food for thought! Otherwise, they seem perfectly sturdy and I am really impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa P.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy them again if needed
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for 7 months now three times a week at the indoor pool. At first I was concerned because my fingers don’t extend far, far enough I thought they should; however, they work great. The Velcro on my left glove isn’t working as well as when it was new. Read some reviews and they said they were having the same problem. I’m going to use these as long as they last and probably purchase them again no matter what. That is, unless someone shows me a better version for the same or similar price.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Franz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for doing laps but also aqua aerobics, too!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these. They are my 2nd pair to purchase/used in the past 3 years. I am in the pool a minimum of 5 days a week and they hold up really well. Rinse and let dry naturally. Good quality. These work fabulous in my aqua classes, too! It gives me an amazing amount of resistance and work so much better than aqua weights!! Warning: Measure correctly or you will be like me and now have a pair of the wrong size sitting around unused. I couldn't remember my last pair size, so I measured and with my hand being right in the middle of a Med and Large, I opted for a large. Nope. Wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Fingers are not suppose to stick out
customer_reviews.text: I went to water aerobics class this morning and a classmate said she liked my gloves. I said they didn’t fit right as my fingers didn’t stick out. She responded explaining that the longer webbing provides more resistance to the water providing me more exercise. Yep. I like my size medium gloves for my water areobics class.
customer_reviews.author: Janice M. Wishau

customer_reviews.title: Great for Water Resistance
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter a size smaller than I had ordered for myself because I ordered mine too large and had to take a tuck in them to make them fit. They seem to run large so I will go down to the small rather than the medium size for my next pair. I wouldn’t think of swimming without these anymore. They are a great product made well with secure Velcro hold on the wrists. I recommend these swim gloves but advise possibly going down a size especially if your wrists are small.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Swim Training Gloves for arthritic hands during water aerobics
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves but I bought a size too small.(medium). I use the gloves in water aerobics to keep my fingers outstretched rather than hold the hand "barbell floats" because my fingers tend to want to curl up when I sleep. The added water resistance the gloves create I think help exercise the muscles to keep my fingers feeling better when I sleep. (I have osteoarthritis all over but keep active).
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Great aid for getting more out of a water aerobic class
customer_reviews.text: These make it so that I get a better work out in my water aerobic class. Makes the water more resistant. The first time that I swam laps with them on, I thought that I was cheating, because I moved so much fast with them on. After a couple of laps I didn't feel like I was cheating, as my arms tired much faster. I think that I like lap swimming better without the gloves, but I like the water aerobic better with the gloves on.
customer_reviews.author: DeLynne

customer_reviews.title: Works but don’t expect it to last beyond six months.
customer_reviews.text: Lasts about six months. Color fades within two months, size loosens soon after, by six months the Velcro is shot. Haven’t found anything that lasts longer in an indoor chlorinated pool. Bought three so far over the last year and a half. No better alternative though on the positive it helps increase your work out as you swim or do water aerobics. I continue to lose inches in my upper arms and don’t get the arthritic pain as I did with water weights.
customer_reviews.author: Noralynn Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Glove💦💦
customer_reviews.text: Only brand I recommend.My second pair..I DWR daily in the pool and they are helping rehab my bad shoulder. My muscles have atrophied and it is slowly getting things stronger around the shoulder(3 surgeries & a replacement) Well made..most of my water gear is Speedo..the best.
customer_reviews.author: G Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Do the job!
customer_reviews.text: These are the 2nd pair I've owned. Lost the first pair. The second time I ordered the smaller size than the chart recommended ... much better fit. I've been using them now for about 5 months. Background: I swim about 5 days/week. Anywhere from 20min to 60 min workouts. Only 2 "negatives": [1] after about 3 months the velcro straps come loose within 15-20 minutes. Perhaps a redesign for a velcro-strap that wraps around the wrist might be good. [2] they seem to wear down relatively quickly around the palm area (about 3 months in). I notice it's the let-hand glove, which is the side I push off on.
customer_reviews.author: CLG

customer_reviews.title: These appear to have good resistance to water; but, not for a comfortable lap swim for my older arms.
customer_reviews.text: It would seem that the product is well made and will work for those who want to use it. The resistance of the glove to the water was more than my arms wanted to feel so I gave the gloves to someone who was accustomed to using them. I am told that this type of glove is something one must adjust to. Basically, my 65 year old arms grew tired fast as I set about doing my 30 laps in a Jr. Olympic pool.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nickel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use during water aerobics. What a difference it makes with resistance!! I bought a medium for a woman with average to a little larger hands. I think the sizing is based on men's sizes. I am very comfortable in them. They have good grips but easier to take off while using weights. I HIGHLY recommend if you want to improve your performance.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly G

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I have used these gloves for years but this pair is highly inferior. The fingers are not consistent size and the small is very big. Not like before,. The gloves faded to grey in one week and the fabric is declining. Not recommended to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: lona Davies

customer_reviews.title: 2 years later
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these gloves for water fitness class. After about a year and a half , maybe 70 uses, the velcro fasteners no longer held well. I had to keep refastening until now they just won't hold anymore. I did rinse off the gloves in the shower after every use. I guess the pool chems got to it. Also, there was some separation of the layers of the top material. The palm material was still good. The seams held up, too.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: These came on time and in excellent condition. They provide a lovely amount of resistance in the water for my physical therapy sessions. The only problem is they are a bit too large but that is my fault for ordering a medium instead of a small. I’m able to use them, though, so no problem. I’m very happy with the quality and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Poe

customer_reviews.title: Color faded when washed first time
customer_reviews.text: I have used these gloves in water aerobics class about 6 times. Velcro seems to be loose at the tips, but holding so far. I accidentally threw them in the washer (just detergent, no bleach and air dry), now one glove is still royal blue and the other glove is light blue. Very disappointed, since these are water gloves, I expected them to be washable without compromising the color.
customer_reviews.author: R. Yielding

customer_reviews.title: Knock offs? Poor quality?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure this is the original product. I had same size and brand before and bought these as a back up as they were on sale from the Amazon warehouse. They were very uncomfortable. Stitching around fingers rough, left ridges along my thumbs. Palm area short and barely fit to my wrist. I have small hands. The fingers much longer than original. Padding seemed flimsy. Managed to find someone who was willing to pay half price and fit her better. Disappointed with these. My original Speedo swim gloves I will continue to use and like them very much for my aqua aerobics class. Hopefully Speedo has not sacrificed their quality from originals I bought over a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: BarbiRN

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the gloves on Sunday and they were delivered Tuesday afternoon. I debated on the size, small vs medium and bought the medium. I think the small would have fit but I’m happy with the medium size. My fingers are completely covered but doesn’t hinder using them. They did have a slight odor when I took them out of the package but it disappeared after the first use. I’m not having any problem with the Velcro. I’ve only used them 5 times but they look like they just came out of the Speedo packaging. I expect to get a lot of use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Vendor is saving money on Velcro
customer_reviews.text: I swim four miles each week. I have used these gloves for years, and they were great. Now, they reduced the area of the Velcro, so that the wrist cuffs easily come apart while swimming. So, you have to stop swimming to reseal the cuff or the cuffs flop back and forth while swimming. Sad. They had a great product and diminished it by (I guess) saving money on the Velcro. More aggravating is that these gloves are relatively expensive. "Why fix it if it isn't broke?"
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good water glove
customer_reviews.text: Having just used the gloves a few times, I like them. If you are looking to add resistance to a pool workout, these will do fine. I have rather large hands and always need XL work gloves but, these fitness gloves seem to run large. That is OK with me, too small would not. I’ll see how they hold up after more uses and I might 5* rate. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neoprene palms an asset.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves about a month ago. I see no wear to date, but my last set lasted (not this brand) a long time. The gloves are easy to put on or take off. I really like the neoprene on the palm as the weights I use hurt my hands. I found the small a little bigger fit than I care for, but this is sometimes a problem as women have smaller hands. So far the gloves show little sign of wear and the Velcro is in good condition. I would recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen M. Meehan

customer_reviews.title: Good for Mild Added Water Resistance
customer_reviews.text: I use these for Aquatic Therapy. They help with gripping the equipment and offering additional resistance in the water. This helps with sensory deficits in the hands and arms. Great if you have brain and/or spine injury. The only negative is the Velcro is not very strong or lasting. It has already lost its strength and they are only a few months old, using them only a couple times per week.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality, and very sturdy Velcro that stays put. I am a woman with large hands, and the large is just a little too big for me. I will give them to my brother and purchase a size medium. They are a little long. My fingertips do not stick out of the tips. They are a little wide at the wrist/Velcro area, and Imfind myself constantly trying to adjust and tighten them.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Meier

customer_reviews.title: Aqua Fit Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These Aqua Fit gloves work great but run larger than what I anticipated. I measured prior to ordering and followed the chart, accordingly. However, a medium is still too large for my hands. That is my only disappointment because I'm afraid they will wear out much faster being loose and sloppy.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with these gloves. I've only been using them for a number of weeks but they seem like they will last a long time. I read a review or two claiming they fell apart quickly but I see no evidence of this happening with mine. They are very comfortable and greatly improve my time in the pool. My goal is to be able to swim more laps without having to stop and rest and these help me keep my arms relaxed as I swim so I don't waste my energy. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: Really Great
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived early and properly pkgd. The mitts fit well and are really a great exercise enhancement. Have only used once so far and can't comment on durability but don't have any reason to not give them a 5-star rating. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: OldOwl

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: These are the best swim gloves I've had. I've had a couple of other kinds which were not well manufactured and fell apart quickly. One thing you have to do with any synthetic swim product is rinse them out after each use because the chlorine and UV sunlight will destroy them quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Bahoover

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I originally had rated this as not stitched so that it was comfortable on my hands. Before I ordered I had measured my hand and found that I was a small. That is what I had ordered and that is what I received. When I got them I eagerly put them on and the stitching dug into my hand so I rated them poorly. Determined to make them work for me I tried them at the pool. Once they were wet I realized that they work fine without any pain on my hands at all. My bad. I should have tried them in the pool before rating them. They work great!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa England

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for training
customer_reviews.text: Used these extensively while doing rehab in pool at add a little more resistance to my arms and propel me a little further with fewer strokes to reduce duration and amount of strokes on my rotator cuff. Helped strengthen my arms and easily washable and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Edelstein

customer_reviews.title: Adds speed and resistance
customer_reviews.text: These are very durable and stay in place when I swim and hold my resistance weights. I like them for swimming as they have enough resistance to give your arm, shoulder and upper arm exercise. I have very small hands so I bought the small and fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Johnneen J.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Like using this product for lap swimming. Adds resistance to workout however does place additional strain on shoulders so be careful not to overexert your self when using. My only complaint is that I ordered yellow gloves and received blue.
customer_reviews.author: DEJ-WI

customer_reviews.title: Tears fairly easily
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed using my gloves, but I've found that the stitching between the thumb and forefinger started to break shortly after I started using them. Since then, the outer mesh layer has been slowly tearing. This hasn't had a HUGE impact on their use, but I wonder how much worse it will get before I have to replace them. Take note that the fitting guide is very exact. I initially ordered the large, thinking that it would be a better fit, but I was mistaken and needed the smaller size for them to feel right in the water. To summarize, not a bad product for the price, but I expected better quality for the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Rudd

customer_reviews.title: Makes my swim workout better
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I chose these gloves. I swim every other day and I wear them always. I can definitely feel that my muscle tone is coming back after months of not being able to work out due to the virus. They are very comfortable, fit well and work wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Szatkowski

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: I grew up using speedo products, but they seem to have gone down in quality. Every other lap i have to stop and redo the velcro. How hard is it to make a good velcro that sticks. I bought two pairs, and both have the same issues. After a couple laps you have to strap the velcro
customer_reviews.author: Chris Walls

customer_reviews.title: Good swim gloves
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, comfortable, well constructed and easy to clean. Only one minor issue, the medium size is still a little large for my hands. Fortunately, the Velcro strips are very secure on my wrists and prevents the gloves from falling off during my swims.
customer_reviews.author: A. T. Ishida

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these as a replacement for swim gloves my husband uses daily. They are the exact same as his worn out pair (that lasted about 3 years). If this pair lasts as long as the last pair we will be pleased. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: rsrandr

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is not accurate!
customer_reviews.text: A have bought many cheaper gloves and decided to buy a more expensive glove hoping to have it last a little longer as I use them at least 3 times per week. I ordered a medium , I always do, but I found it to be so large that I used them once and then gave them away to a fellow swimmer whom always wears a size large glove. I feel their sizing is off!
customer_reviews.author: Fern L

customer_reviews.title: So far so good but....
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I ordered the XL Large because other gloves always seem to wear small.. Not these in-fact they are slight to big for me,but i'm using them anyway, but i have smaller size anyways ... I like them and they feel good, so yeah i would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have used these gloves about four times a week for a couple months, and I have no complaints. I am noticing that the tips of the Velcro closures do not stay attached any more, and I hope this will not happen to the rest of the closure.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: FIT, FIT, FIT.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the recommendations from other ratings on the fit of these gloves I went with a size Large. I usually wear XL's. I found them very snug, the right hand fit as I assumed they were supposed to. The left hand was so tight It would not go on without allot of work and never did feel right. I've worn them a few times and the extra help/resistance in swimming and water aerobics is great. I am considering getting a larger size as I do not want to fight with the ones I have every time I put them on. I might even use them if they went on easier, that's why a 2 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: keys wanabe

customer_reviews.title: After just two months they are falling apart !!
customer_reviews.text: I have had my gloves for two months and swim five days a week. At first I love them, but about three weeks ago the stitching started to come out from between the fingers, and now the edging. There are a lot of reviews about how durable these are, but mine are falling apart. Very unhappy with this As they provided a great workout. However, I’m not going to be replacing them every two months.
customer_reviews.author: kevin conorich

customer_reviews.title: Great for water resistance exercises (and swimming too)
customer_reviews.text: I use these for water resistance training. They work great. I even do push ups outside the pool with them. They also make swimming strokes fun as they are like fins for your hands. Like Kevin costner in water world.
customer_reviews.author: Aidin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Is always a concern for me when ordering gloves. I wear XXL with about every type of glove I buy. The see fit very nicely with a little room to spare. They work great! I use these with the Aqua Sphere fins and a snorkel for pool exercise. Couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: W. Brunner

customer_reviews.title: They work and are holding up well
customer_reviews.text: they are a bit oversized and they faded after about 1 month. However, I use them every day for training and the durability is still there. Overall I like them and recommend them to everyone needing training gloves...
customer_reviews.author: It's Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Using this is harder than I thought. Not because it's hard to use but because of the tension versus the water. It time I'll get the hang of it. I gave it 4 stars because I wish it were lighter. It's pretty light when dry but the material absorbs much more water than I expected which makes it a bit heavy and uncomfortable. But just a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jay J.

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my water aerobics class and also just to mess around and play. I love how they add an extra level of difficulty and challenge to my workouts and how they help me move through the water. I enjoy them!
customer_reviews.author: A. Lovell-Gordinier

customer_reviews.title: Good way to add resistance
customer_reviews.text: My mom says she loves these, for her Aqua classes at the pool. She goes twice a week, so she liked having the added resistance. I have a rotator cuff muscle injury, and when I tried these even once, it was way too much for my shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Fit and function is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I first ordered Speedo Aquatic Water Resistance Fitness Gloves in a small (black with yellow wrists).They were too small in the baby finger and the stitching pinched. I returned them and bought these in a small.My hands measure 8 cm exactly across the palm. Perfect, snug fit and function. No problem with the Velcro straps. I use them for aqua fit classes and to do laps. They give just enough resistance to really work my arms and chest. I rinse them with tap water and hang to dry. They dry in a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Judene M Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Gloves too large.
customer_reviews.text: I have a large hand so ordered Medium....they are too big. There was no size chart when I ordered. I would like to return & change size to small. They were used once.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Haddad

customer_reviews.title: The Must Have Swim Gloves
customer_reviews.text: If you love to swim laps or do pool exercise classes, these are great for swimming(which I originally bought them for), and for exercise as they add resistance to the exercise motions. I go to a Joints In Motion class for 1 hour, twice a week at a Wellness Center and Physical Therapy Center because of 5 ortho surgeries and I have Parkinson's disease. These have been a great benefit to my upper body exercises. I highly recommend them for swimming and exercises. This is my second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I am Paddle Man
customer_reviews.text: These are a little too long and at the same time a bit too tight. I have very large hands. The quality is excellent, however. They help speed up the propulsion through the water significantly. Any task you need to use all the dexterity of your fingers may force you to take them off, however. A little bit of a struggle getting them on and off as they fit tight, yet seem to be a little too long in the finger length. This may be intentional as it provides more propulsion through the water. I'd recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Jungle Jim

customer_reviews.title: Feel the difference...
customer_reviews.text: First freestyle with this was fantastic. I did a 'dumb' though - I put them on with the yellow side on my palms. Does't work very well for grip when getting out of the pool! Ha! The underneath side is solid black with a soft textured rubber surface that is intended to be for your palm/grip. I'll come back and update after a few weeks using them.
customer_reviews.author: Atomkey

customer_reviews.title: Offers very little resistance
customer_reviews.text: This product offers very little resistance , I get so much of a better workout from the aqua dumbbells. If you are looking for a light resistance this is for you. Also the medium fits pretty large, I would go down a size.
customer_reviews.author: CryHTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: I like swim gloves for resistance traing in the pool
customer_reviews.text: I like swim gloves for resistance traing in the pool, but these gloves are akward to put on and take off. The finger section's are very tight, it's a struggle to peel back from the top and pull off. It would be very nice to have shorter finger length for people who have smaller hands.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Not really for competition training or lap swimming
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like these as much as the hard plastic type. They seem to run large too. I would have gotten the plastic type looking back. They have less resistance than the plastic type too. They have held up well and they comfortable but not a repeat buy
customer_reviews.author: RealisticCynic

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Ice been using these for water aerobics for a few months. Actually, I can't make the classes anymore, so I just walk laps in the pool doing different things. I love that I can use these gloves inatead of weights since I usually end up banging those on my thigh.
customer_reviews.author: yankeebelle

customer_reviews.title: No more sore wrists!
customer_reviews.text: Water aerobics must have! Support for wrists and it makes me use my arm muscles more. I swear my arms are more toned already after just a few weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail E.

customer_reviews.title: Go for a swim.
customer_reviews.text: These work okay but are not easy to put on and finger movement is very restricted. Removing is also a challenge as it is hard to grab one glove with a glove on the other hand. The construction is good and they do help move more water. However, I find I use them only once in a while because of the issues with putting them on, taking them off and then using your hands for anything else. It would be nicer if they were more flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Birdieman

customer_reviews.title: Small hand-long fingers
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'5" woman and ordered small which was recommended on size chart according to measurement of my palm. The palm fit pretty good but the fingers were not long enough such that the finger stitching cut into the webbing between my fingers. Medium would be better. Otherwise love the way these work out my arms. Can really feel the difference. Update: These gloves are still going strong for a second summer of swimming. No tears or rips. I swim in a lake so no exposure to chlorine and I do not lay them in the sun to dry so maybe limited UV is prolonging their life.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: VERY COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are the best and so far, the velcro has continued to firmly stay fastened unlike some of the other swim gloves that I have purchased. Well worth the price! I generally swim for a mile per session and these gloves offer the right amount of resistance. BUY THEM NOW!
customer_reviews.author: anthony mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great to resistance for starting out
customer_reviews.text: I swim backstroke due to inflexibility in my neck. These gloves provide nice resistance in order to develop strength in my arms and shoulders. They allow me to move a bit faster than no gloves. I will eventually look for something more firm as my arms become better able to handle more resistance. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: Gtokaren

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. Work great for Water Aerobics. Have 2 pairs. Great quality and looks to last for a long time. Figure your size though. Fingers are long and cover most of the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Great glove with one big flaw!
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves as far as performance in water. I use for water exercise. Plus they come in small, med, and large which makes a big difference for performance. Biggest complaint is the velcro doesn't last at the wrist and repeatedly comes undone causing the glove to loosen and interrupt the workout. I rinse these gloves after every workout to help last longer. If i knew how to sew and replace the velcro it would solve the problem!
customer_reviews.author: Juliefit

customer_reviews.title: Wife wants a pair now!
customer_reviews.text: I just received these today and tried them in my swim spa. I am 6'4" with 3xl hands. The XL size I ordered was a perfect fit. The quality seems excellent and they were fun to swim with.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Have used for a few times. But I think ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used for a few times. But I think do not expect your fingers to stick out so much because it is designed to maximize water resistance so even my hand is for sure medium, but i ordered small due to other reviews said it runs big. It feels tight when it is off the water and my fingers still not sticking out. But luckily, when it's under water, it stretches out and feels ok
customer_reviews.author: Dragon

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I thought I was getting. A bit pricy for a neoprene glove, but I haven't had any issues with it over the couple months I've been using them regularly. I had to get the largest size, but fortunately that fit. Normally I wear a 2x or 3x glove depending on the cut.
customer_reviews.author: Underground

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for better quality
customer_reviews.text: Soft, flexible, very comfortable. Great quality, strong stitching. Great for swimming or for water resistance training. Very happy with them, and happy I spent the extra couple bucks on the Speedo ones rather than the cheap knockoffs. These will last well and I will use them regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With These Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I use these 5 days a week for pool exercise. They feel good, but a little hard to get off, as you should expect. Lots of water resistance, so my workout is improved. They lasted less than 4 months
customer_reviews.author: PopThinks

customer_reviews.title: If you use them a lot buy cheaper ones. These fall apart rather quickly.
customer_reviews.text: They really power up your workout and are very easy to use, like most gloves. They do fall apart rather quickly as noted in the photo at about the same rate as cheaper gloves. These gloves were bought in July.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: Nicely designed for resistance training in the water. Also, the grippy design works well for being in the water, placing hands outside on wet hot pavement and pulling self out of pool to stenghthen upper back and arms. Easy to pack for exercising in pool, beach, river or lake. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: LittleRascal

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT! HAPPY WITH ONGOiNG RESULTS (:
customer_reviews.text: Excellent equipment for my shoulder replacement therapy in the pool.I bought size Large and they are fine. They have been great help in regaining strength, flexibility and toning in my shoulders and upper arms. They are fun P.T. . ! I am a 65 year old female. It has been 9 months since surgery. Yes ,I am happy with these gloves. (:
customer_reviews.author: ♥

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: Love these swim gloves, they are so comfortable, great water resistance, and so far seem very durable. I would recommend these to everyone. I use it in my swim spa along with short swim fins, I get a really great workout.
customer_reviews.author: greeneyes

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again for pool excercise
customer_reviews.text: Since gym has been closed I have been working out in the pool almost every day. This does help with resistance for arm toning. I have very small hands and they were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Work those Flappy Upper Arms
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality and do just what they need to do. Easy to get on/off and really work your arms in the water. Everyone in our morning aquatics class has tried them out, then asked me to send them this link so they can buy a set for themselves. A good item to add to my aqua fitness routine.
customer_reviews.author: Artdoll

customer_reviews.title: Good workout
customer_reviews.text: When they say medium they mean the amount of effort put forth by the user, NOT the size. I'm a senior and have been using gloves for a long time. My old ones wore out, so I put these on and did the same routine. OUCH...a few days later... now, I've worked up to it again. Love these gloves. I have smaller hands so my finger tips don't show. I get the full impact of the resistance. Durable and holding up well. I've used them for over a year 2x a week. I do always rinse them as I do my suit and other equipment. Would buy again. PS: you'll "fly" through the water using these. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kathy LP

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these exercise gloves. They are fabulous in the pool and have built up the strength in my arms and helped reduce the pain I was feeling prior to using them. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: mary ann

customer_reviews.title: Good for swim training, water walking and water aerobics.
customer_reviews.text: I water walk. These help me not only move faster but get a really good arm and shoulder workout. They do make you more bouyent able and able to tread water longer. They run large. I have quite large hands for female and the small size fit me best.
customer_reviews.author: N.C. Langwiser-Kear

customer_reviews.title: Great for Arthritis also.
customer_reviews.text: These web gloves provide me with the support I need for my arthritis in my hands. I do water aerobics 3 times a week and after my hands ache. After wearing these gloves, my hands do not ache after. It also gives me more resistance for my arms as the product was made for. I highly recommend this if you have carpal tunnel or arthritis in your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Pdlt

customer_reviews.title: Great little swim gloves! I love the color!
customer_reviews.text: I really like my swim gloves. I love the color and the fit. They are comfortable. I'm already known as "the lady with they yellow feet and hands!" Hope they come out with more colors. Might as well make a splash!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but wrist does not have much give
customer_reviews.text: The wrist is a bit tight but not uncomfortable. Works I great and has added to my workout. Fingers are also not too long so I was able to maintain some dexterity while using.
customer_reviews.author: baxter710

customer_reviews.title: Great! If they didn't fall apart...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my hands, the added resistance is what I expected. Durability doesn't look promising. The stitching is starting to come off after less than ten uses.
customer_reviews.author: michelena

customer_reviews.title: Sizing very large
customer_reviews.text: Resistance is fair but i think it's because gloves run very large. At first I ordered a size smaller than what was recommended and now have the smallest amd have large hands. Would prefer a snugger fit. Don't follow size guidelines on review from years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: I think this is due to me putting on the right handed glove last and therefore can not get a good grip to pull it on
customer_reviews.text: I have had them about 4 months. I typically swim 5 days/week for about 1hr/day. I rinse the gloves after each workout. The material is fading and the seams at the finger tips are fraying. R=The right hand glove wrist seam ripped about a week ago. I think this is due to me putting on the right handed glove last and therefore can not get a good grip to pull it on. Sort of disappointing that they did not hold up longer:(
customer_reviews.author: B2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: These have been great for adding resistance to my water workouts. I absolutely recommend these to add that next boost to your workout- they are fun and they give you a lot of power if you want to swim or do “tricks” in the water
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, love the product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I have been using them for awhile now, much better than cheaper ones that I purchased in the past. They fit large so I bought a small and they fit perfect. I generally wear a ladies medium.
customer_reviews.author: dbedmonton

customer_reviews.title: They really work and add resistant.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased another pair from another seller and they were way to small, these work great and you can adjust the fit w/ the Velcro straps.
customer_reviews.author: B. Or D. Beadles

customer_reviews.title: Fit and flexible
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a couple of other brands and these are the ones I prefer. They fit my hands and feel good. Another pair I had were so stiff I couldn't bend my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Nice training gloves at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: They really increased the water resistance and enhanced my workout. Shipping was very fast. You may want to check the size you buy. I sized up to an XL because a size L pair I bought from a different vendor were too tight. These were just a bit loose, but still work quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Cuchine

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Wrist grip became lose in less than 2 months. Should ask for refund or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amit S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on other brands resistance gloves
customer_reviews.text: Overall Great product. Only issue is the pool chemicals break down the neoprene so the stitching unravels after many, many, many hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: James Young

product_meta.title: Speedo Aqua Fit Swim Training Gloves
product_meta.description:
A Neoprene glove with webbed fingers and a rubber palm with adjustable wrist closure and ultra flexible webbing for use during water resistance training. Helps create smoother movement in the water for a more comfortable upper body workout. They also add propulsion through the water. Ideal for water aerobics and pool workouts.

AMAZON.COM
Speedo's Aquatic Fitness Gloves provide increased resistance in water for greater toning and strengthening of muscles and cardiovascular exercise for your heart and lungs. Made from neoprene, the gloves feature webbed fingers, a rubber palm, and adjustable wrist closure. You'll get smoother movement in water for a more comfortable upper body workout and increased propulsion through the water. 

 About Speedo
In 1914, Speedo was founded in Australia by Alexander MacRae, a 22-year-old Scottish immigrant who arrived in the country in 1910. The company began when MacRae Hosiery manufacturers, established by Alexander in 1914, extended the manufacture of underwear to swimwear and became MacRae Knitting Mills. A naming competition was held by the staff in 1928 and won by a Captain Parsonson, who coined the slogan, "Speed on in your Speedos." In 1929, the first swimsuits were in production and it didn’t take long for Speedo to successfully establish itself. World War II caused the brand turn over 90% of it’s manufacturing to war production, providing the armed services with vital equipment such as mosquito nets. After the war, Speedo opened a new factory and was able to re-establish itself, due to increased demand for swimsuits. In 1951, Speedo Knitting Mills (Holdings) Ltd, was incorporated and became a publicly traded company on the Sydney Stock exchange.

 Speedo hit the international stage in earnest, at the 1956 Melbourne Olympic Games, and a few years later the brand grew on a more global scale. Export sales to the USA began and an international division was set up to monitor trade in New Zealand, Japan and South Africa. The expansion of the brand continued, and in 1976, Speedo was appointed as the official swimwear for the 1976 Montreal Olympics, where 52 out of 54 countries wore their swimsuits.

 Speedo continues to make its mark in the pool and on the beach today. Many world class athletes who wear Speedo include U.S. phenomenon Michael Phelps, legendary Australian swimmer Grant Hackett, world record holder Kosuke Kitajima from Japan, and Holland’s Inge de Bruijn.

What's in the Box?
Two neoprene Speedo Aqua Fit Training Gloves
feature_bullets: Flexible webbing for water resistance training
